name: Resume Eelco Hillenius
body:
Sixteen years of professional software development experience, in a wide variety of roles including architecture, engineering management, product management and hands-on coding, ranging from green field development, re-architecting legacy software, to integration projects including ERP and LMS software, in various industries including health care, finance, retail and education.

* Pragmatic, hands-on, ‘gets things done’

* Inspirational, natural lead

* Generalist with depth in technology

## Technical skills

### Java (1997-Present)

Expert knowledge of the language and most frameworks that matter including Storm, Kafka, Guice, Jersey, Spring, jOOQ, GWT, etc. Contributed to multiple open source projects, including significant portions of web framework Apache Wicket.

### Clojure (2012-Present)

Used Clojure for ETL and reporting problems and various web site prototypes for about a year pretty much exclusively. Currently using it for tools and prototypes as my go-to personal language.

### SQL/ RDBMS (1997-Present)

Strong data modeling and SQL skills. Extensive experience with MySQL, DB2, SAPDB, HSQL, Derby and Oracle. Designed Teachscape's data warehouse and schemas behind some of the core applications.

### NoSQL (2009-Present)

Used Neo4J and MongoDB in several projects, some experience with Redis and Hadoop, up-to-date understanding of current NoSQL landscape. Also hands-on experience with various Amazon products including Redshift.

### JavaScript (1999-Present)

Experience with front-end frameworks like jQuery, Angular, YUI, Scriptaculous, Dojo and ExtJS. Some experience with Node.js, using Express and Jade.

### C# (2003-2006)

Worked on two web application projects and a desktop application.

### Operating Systems

OSX, Linux, Windows, OS/400

### Other

Used Python, Ruby, Flex, Bash, Objective C, Groovy, RPG/400, Delphi, Clipper and various SCM (Git, Mercurial, SVN, SVN), build tools (Maven, Ant, Leiningen, Gradle, Jenkins, Bamboo) and development tools (including Eclipse, for which I’ve developed plugins) in projects.

## Relevant experience

### Senior Software Engineer, OneSpot; Austin, TX (since 02/2014)

OneSpot is an ad-tech company focussed on content marketing, intelligence and automation

* Refactoring code base of automated bidder to make it scalable for development and optimize

* Introducing stream processing solution to do things like calculating aggregates in a scalable fashion (up to billions of data points per day), using Kafka and Storm amongst other technologies.

* Implementing intelligent load balancer for bidder

* Prototyped web development new style (to migrate away from Ruby on Rails to JVM based solution for backend, single page - Angular, Grunt etc - front end)

### Chief Architect, Teachscape; San Francisco, CA (04/2013 - 01/2014)

Teachscape combines software tools, content and engagements to improve teacher effectiveness.

* Designed and implemented entire make-over of Teachscape’s analytics and reporting pipeline, including ETL, data warehouse, and tooling such as Tableau (including designing templates for multi-tenant reports and user integration with their backend), and an overhaul of their process to streamline report production etc.

* Chief architect of new platform. Built Single Sign On (SSO) and back-office (customer
management) solutions and led adoption Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), data migration
projects and integration 3rd party Learning Management System. Built many of the APIs and integrations needed for the new architecture to work.

### Director Software Engineering, Teachscape; San Francisco, CA (06/2010 - 03/2013)

* Hired, managed team of about ten full time software engineers and various outsourcing
partners.

* Led development of the first release of flagship product ‘Reflect’.

### Senior Software Architect, Teachscape; San Francisco, CA (05/2009 - 05/2010)

* Created tools, frameworks and development standards that are used for all development projects.

* Laid foundations for several projects including Measures of Effective Teaching (Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation).

* Led re-architecture of an acquired product.

### Lead Developer, Teachscape; San Francisco, CA (10/2005 - 03/2009)

* Core developer of Teachscape’s main SaaS platform.

* Led the implementation of the award wining Classroom Walkthrough products.

* Recruited most of the software engineers who were involved in building the platform.

### Owner, Code Droid; Lelystad, The Netherlands (06/2005 - 10/2006)

* Short consulting engagements to give advice on architecture, coding practices and development processes.

### Software Architect, Topicus B.V.; Deventer, The Netherlands (04/2002 - 05/2005)

Topicus B.V. is an award winning IT service provider that caters to the finance, health care and education sectors. I was the eleventh employee (3rd engineer) and help lay the foundations of many product lines in use today. While I worked there, the company grew to about a hundred full time people, and today employs nearly five hundred.

Projects included:

* Back-end system for Electronic Medical Records exchange and health care chain integration.

* Administrative systems for primary and for secondary education.

* Product configurator for a large customer in the financial sector.

### Software Engineer and Project Lead; Blue Point B.V.; Hengelo, The Netherlands — 02/1998 - 03/2002

Blue Point B.V. was a leading services provider for AS/400 systems and ERP and CRM installations.

* Built Java business unit from scratch to about eight engineers (included training, project management etc).

* Lead developer of e-Commerce platform.

* Various integration projects.

## Education

* Saxon Universities, Deventer, The Netherlands — Bachelor of Business Administration in Management Information Systems, 1998

### Certifications

* Computer Science certifications from EXIN (Examination Institute for Information Science), Utrecht, The Netherlands (AMBI certificates MG1, HG1, HG2, HG3, HP1, HP2, HP4, HP5 and HP6).

* Saxon Universities Deventer, The Netherlands - Export Marketing.

* Dutch Marketing Institute NIMA, Amsterdam, The Netherlands - NIMA-A certification

## Publications

* Wicket In Action, Manning Publications Co.
